attributes.action: Deliberate a vote of No Confidence in Jeremy Hunt the Health Secretary.
attributes.background: Following the demise of the NHS through lack of funding please deliberate a vote of No Confidence in Jeremy Hunt the Health Secretary to change the direction of the NHS and protect it for future generation's. Our lives depend on it!

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all companies to recycle
attributes.background: Currently companies including large multinational ones such as macdonalds, cineworld and other industrial companies use plenty of material that is recyclable. However I have noticed that most don't offer the option to do so and most of this material ends up in landfill.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies open to the public should provide recycling stations where the discarded items can be separated into recyclable and non-recyclable waste. 
All businesses should manage their waste into these categories to help protect the environment for all life on earth.

attributes.action: Stop bombing syria and provide support.
attributes.background: In syria a child's life is worth a bullet in the chamber of a soldier, the lives of all the mothers and children that die are only seen as colletral damage to the superpowers of the world, thats why i believe support from the united kingdom would be of much help to re-developing a nation.

attributes.action: Introduce a phased ban on multiple point fishing hooks for all leisure angling
attributes.background: For future generations, the welfare and conservation of all native fish species will benefit from a phased UK ban on multiple point hooks for all leisure (sea, coarse and game) angling. This petition proposes to change government policy, restricting anglers to using one single fishing hook per rod.
attributes.additional_details: Leisure angling is one of our biggest recreational pastimes. Whether as a requirement or personal preference, fish should be returned to the water quickly and unharmed. Whilst conservation measures, including a ban on lead weights, help to protect native fish and other wildlife, leisure angling’s use of multiple point hooks remains its Achilles heel. Removal is more time consuming, increases fish stress and the likelihood of harm or death. There are no grounds for defending multiple point hooks.

attributes.action: Save cyclists' lives by introducing 'The Dutch Reach' into the Driving Test
attributes.background: To simply and cheaply save cyclists' lives, we need to require a person to use their opposite hand to open a car door if they are to pass a driving test. This turns the body bringing passing cyclists into view.
attributes.additional_details:
This tiny change is called 'The Dutch Reach' as it is used in the Netherlands.  It saves people on bikes from being knocked into traffic when people open car doors. Using the opposite hand to open a car door forces the body to turn, so the driver sees the cyclist and fewer people are injured and killed on the roads. Such as this incident:

http://gu.com/p/5g79g?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other 

Video: see http://www.pri.org/stories/2016-09-27/easy-maneuver-borrowed-dutch-could-be-life-saving-cyclists

attributes.action: Stop Corporation tax cuts and put the Money into Social Care.
attributes.background: £4.6 BILLION in corporation tax cuts is currently being planned by the Tory Party.   Yesterday, Wednesday 14th Dec, in the last Prime ministers question time of the year,  Jeremy Corbyn MP appealed for the £4.6b in corporation tax cuts be put into Social care instead to help solve this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
The Tory government has cut Social Care and the PM, cabinet, and everybody else knows the effects of these cuts.This crisis is a difficult one for many elderly people because it is also a crisis for the NHS. Those people who are in hospital cannot be discharged because there is nowhere else for them to go. The crisis affects individuals, families and The NHS. 

References
https://youtu.be/p_gl4Z-PJTk

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/m.huffpost.com/uk/entry/uk_585149c8e4b08b39538f4bf0/amp

https://www.politicshome.com/news/uk/politics/news/81735/live-prime-ministers-questions-141216

attributes.action: Make a law against Balloon and Chinese Lantern Releases.
attributes.background: Daily Balloon and Chinese Lantern Releases are taking place. More animals are dying because of this. Animals can mistake litter for its' food when it eats this litter, it clogs up its guts - eventually killing it. With this, more species of animals are dying. Plus, it pollutes our environment.
attributes.additional_details: Balloon and Chinese Lantern Releases usually take place, because of the start of a new life, or the end of a life. Instead of polluting our wildlife and environment, plant a tree. It is much cheaper, and will last a lot longer! A little plaque can be placed in front of it, to dedicate the memory of somebody, or a time/event. It is a lot cheaper, efficient and friendly (both socially and environmentally).

attributes.action: Introduce a 'Safe Haven' law for abandoned babies in the UK
attributes.background: Around 500 babies are abandoned each year in the UK, that's 9 a week! Here in the UK its currently illegal to leave a baby in a safe place if the parent feels they can no longer look after them, but in all 50 states of America they have a 'Safe haven' law to protect vulnerable children and parents
attributes.additional_details:
The safe haven law allows unharmed children under 3 weeks of age to be surrendered anonymously and safely to a designated place with no questions asked. This insures that babies are not abandoned in cold or dangerous conditions or worse still neglected. 
Whilst this is a highly emotive issue, this law will not encourage pregnant women to abandon their children, what it will do is protect societies most venerable and those that need it most the babies. Please help me protect the these babies.

attributes.action: "Remain" should not be an option if a second referendum is agreed.
attributes.background:
Including "remain" in any second referendum on the deal achieved by the UK government would only serve to undermine the governments position and be intended to prevent the UK leaving the European Union.

MPs that wish to ignore the vote of the British people should reveal themselves.
attributes.additional_details:
All too often "I respect the outcome of the referendum to leave the European Union...but" is uttered by fervent supporters of the EU.  

It is all too often accompanied by proposals of a second referendum "on the terms" of our exit from the EU; this is designed to undermine UK government negotiations and ultimately thwart the outcome of the referendum of the 23rd June 2016.

A second referendum should only be on the terms agreed to EXIT the EU.

attributes.action: A life sentence to mean life imprisonment.
attributes.background: A life sentence handed out to criminals should mean they spend the rest of their life behind bars with no option for early release
attributes.additional_details: All too often we hear of people being sentenced for horrific crimes and murders and are told they've been given a 'life sentence ' of which they must serve a minimum of 4 years or something ridiculous like that. Life should mean life, to combat the response of "we don't have the money or the space" - in these cases bring back the death penalty for murderers and child abusers who show no remorse and stop imprisoning people for petty offences like 'possession of cannabis'

attributes.action: Make driving 25mph or more UNDER the speed limit a punishable offence.
attributes.background: When driving on dual carriage ways or 50mph A roads getting stuck behind drivers who are driving at a speed significantly slower than the speed limit set is a common occurence. It causes unnecessary over taking and can potentially be as dangerous as someone speeding. It needs to be addressed.

attributes.action: Install speed cameras along the A52 from Priory island to Bramcote island.
attributes.background: To many people are tragically losing their lives along this stretch of road as people see it as a race track, I propose that speed cameras are installed to deter and hopefully lower the number of deaths that occur on this road.
attributes.additional_details: After a tragic accident on the 25th November 2016 that killed 2 people because of dangerous driving, this could have been prevented with speed cameras.

attributes.action: Legalize the medicinal use and sale of Cannabis via prescription.
attributes.background:
Millions of people throughout the world and in the UK suffer from conditions of which Cannabis offers a significant and harmless relief. 
To name a few:
-Glaucoma
-Seizures (Dravet's syndrome)
-Alzheimer's Disease
-Multiple Sclerosis
-Arthritis
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.who.int/medicines/access/controlled-substances/6_2_cannabis_update.pdf

http://www.encod.org/info/700-MEDICINAL-USES-OF-CANNABIS.html

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all new parents to learn CPR before leaving maternity unit
attributes.background: Any new parent should be taught CPR and basic life support skills before leaving the maternity into with their newborn child. This should include choking, unconsciousness, CPR to help increase chance of survival if the unimaginable happens.

attributes.action: Require the Cabinet ministers to have experience relevant to their roles.
attributes.background: In most public sector jobs the relevant Cabinet minister has little/no experience actually doing any of the jobs they oversee. It would give them more credibility if they have done the jobs in the sector that they're responsible for. eg.The minister for health should have worked in healthcare.

attributes.action: Petition to make Dementia Awareness a mandatory subject in citizenship
attributes.background: I currently work in a dementia and complex needs hospital for the mental health service in the east of England. As we are aware, mental health has a stigma; and many don't realise dementia does too! Basic dementia awareness is not known to the general public. This needs to change and quickly.
attributes.additional_details:
Dementia is an umbrella term for a range of cognitive impairments, that progressively get worse over time.
According to Alzheimer's Society - "There are 850,000 people with dementia in the UK, with numbers set to rise to over 1 million by 2025. 225,000 will develop dementia this yea; that’s one every three minutes!" And most shockingly "There are over 40,000 people under 65 with dementia in the UK".

Yet, many people do not have basic understanding of the signs and symptoms for Dementia.

attributes.action: Ensure that fireworks remain unrestricted to the general public.
attributes.background: A petition to ensure that the general public can (and in future will be able to) purchase fireworks for home displays without undue restrictions.

attributes.action: 1p and 2p coins should be removed from circulation (cash transactions only)
attributes.background:
We the undersigned want to see the 1p and 2p pieces removed from circulation, since they are no longer of a useful value.

Over time, due to inflation, the value of a coin decreases. The one and two penny pieces are now worth so little that we cannot buy anything useful with them.
attributes.additional_details:
It is important to clarify that this petition is not asking for ALL transactions to be rounded to the nearest 5p. This petition only applies to cash. It calls for removal of 1p and 2p coins, therefore any cash transaction would result in change given rounded to the nearest 5p.

Examples
- If I were to use cash to buy a bottle of milk costing 99p, I would receive no change, since 1p rounds down to zero.

- If I were to buy a cake costing 96p, I would receive 5p change, because 4p rounds up to 5p.

attributes.action: Reinstate George Osborne's plan to set up a 2nd hand annuity market
attributes.background: People have been waiting nearly two years to be able to sell their poor monthly payments for cash lump sums where they can make a difference to their lives.   For example, I've sat with no working boiler as I can't afford one without my annuity funds in one payment.

attributes.action: make abortion illegal in the uk unless raped or health risks to mum or baby
attributes.background: make abortion illegal in the united kingdom unless pregnant by rape or there is health risks to the mum and/or baby

attributes.action: Full pension rights for people thrown out  of the navy for living with ts person
attributes.background: Living with ts person was illegal back in 82, I was kicked out for this crime but I was 21 at the time and doing nothing wrong under cival law, now a days you get to stay in if you fall in love with a ts.I find it repugnent not to eben have had a simple sorry from the powers that be.

attributes.action: No confidence vote in Amber Rudd for denying visa to bone marrow donor.
attributes.background: May Brown, 23, from Dorset, who has leukaemia, has been told that her Nigerian sister Martha is a "10 out of 10" tissue match.  However, the Home Office denied a visa because "all visa applications must be assessed against the immigration rules".
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-dorset-37656377

attributes.action: Increase the number of specialist road traffic officers to reduce road deaths
attributes.background: 10,732 people died on UK roads between 2010 and 2015. In the period Jan to March 2016 alone saw a 14% increase in reported road deaths. Without the fear of detection, non-compliance of road safety rules and laws is noticeably increasing. Enforcement is no longer supporting education or engineering
attributes.additional_details:
"The level of enforcement on our roads is woefully inadequate, 
between 2010 and 2014 the UK has seen a 27% reduction in the number of specialist road traffic police on the roads (falling from 5,338 to 3,901) outside of London". Brake-the road safety charity
Without a visible police presence, road users no longer fear being caught and are increasing non-compliant and yet detection rates are falling
Between 2010-15 133,565 people were seriously injured
Motor insurers paid out £27m per day in 2015

attributes.action: Ban the use of driverless cars before it's too late.
attributes.background: They are danger to other road users. An absurd idea and will cause the death of many pedestrians that could of been avoided. If you don't want to drive then get a taxi. They are not safe for anyone other than the passenger.

attributes.action: To change the laws on criminals being prosecuted on the account of rape.
attributes.background: This petition is to change the minimum jail sentence length and to rule out community service as a legitimate charge. Victims dealing with cases such as this deserve to be able to go about their lives as they wish, without having the fear of running into their offenders.
attributes.additional_details: Personally, I don't think that community service is an appropriate sentence for someone being convicted of rape. The victims and their families would have been put through hell and the perpetrator receiving community service for however long is basically letting them get away with it, when the victims deserve a lot more justice for the crime that was committed.

attributes.action:
Petition
Allow farmers to grow hemp without restriction.
attributes.background: Remove all restrictions on growing industrial hemp. Although the industrial strains of the plant have no psychoactive potential, the absurd level of control has effectively destroyed its value as an agricultural crop. The fibres , the oils , plastics- endless possibilities all natural
attributes.additional_details: Bees on the endangered species list - kind of important due to pollination - bees love hemp..

attributes.action: Make it law to carry a breakdown warning triangle in every motor vehicle.
attributes.background: If a warning triangle is displayed 100 metres behind a broken down vehicle, it will decrease the chances of someone else crashing into it. What if you had broken down somewhere awkward like a roundabout or a bridge without a hard shoulder?
attributes.additional_details:
It is already mandatory in France to carry a warning triangle.

It alerts other road users to a breakdown so they have enough time to react.

It is very effective on motorways where there is no hard shoulder.

It is known to reduce the amount of accidents involving broken down vehicles.

attributes.action: Force the government to raise the threshold of inheritance tax to £1,000,000.
attributes.background: Current threshold for inheritance tax is £325,000. After that a 40% rate is applied.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/inflationandpriceindices/bulletins/housepriceindex/2015-04-14

https://www.gov.uk/inheritance-tax/overview

attributes.action: Facilitate access and use of Automatic External Defibrillators (AED's)
attributes.background:
"In emergency medicine, the golden hour is the period following traumatic injury being sustained by a casualty, during this hour there is the highest likelihood that prompt medical treatment will prevent death."

For heart related emergency's the early use of an AED can be key for preserving life.
attributes.additional_details:
It is frustrating to know that AED technology is out there and publicly available and that many first aiders are trained in AED use.

I acknowledge and welcome this progress but it's difficult to get these two components together at the right place at the right time to make full use of the Golden Hour of patient care.

I ask parliament to vigorously consider the following:

1. Funding/grants so trained first aiders have their own AED.

2. A database of public AED's that can be added to mobile phone maps.

attributes.action: Seek a UN treaty on mutual recognition and enforcement of telephone privacy laws
attributes.background: Despite using the TPS, I have been bombarded with spam telephone calls from India and some other foreign countries. Many of these calls are barely disguised scams. Within the EU there is mutual recognition of such schemes and it works well. This should be extended by treaty to all nations in the ITU
attributes.additional_details:
TPS = Telephone Preference Service
ITU = International Telecommunications Union, a UN agency

To understand what gave me this idea, see: https://www.quora.com/What-is-the-creepiest-phone-call-or-voice-message-youve-ever-received/answer/Peter-Charlot and my (Charles Stuart) comment.

Ofcom recognizes that people outside the EU are beyond their control. I would like a treaty to address this and set up mandatory reciprocal recognition of cold calling laws among ITU member states.

attributes.action: Reduce the working day to 6 hours with the same salary.
attributes.background:
Companies in Sweden have reduced the working hours of their employees to six hours, reporting happier staff, a lower turnover rate, and an increase in profits in that time.

Who doesn't want to spend more time with their friends and family, whilst also being more motivated and productive at work?
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/sweden-introduces-six-hour-work-day-a6674646.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/business/the-six-hour-work-day-increases-productivity-so-will-britain-and-america-adopt-one-sweden-a7066961.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-34677949

attributes.action: Make ASLs (Bicycle boxes) illegal for motor vehicles to stop or rest in.
attributes.background: The Advanced Stop Line (Bicycle box) is consistently and wrongly used by motor vehicles stop in, despite it not being allowed, it's not a fineable offence unless an officer sees one enter it. They are there for cyclists safety and should be treated like yellow box junctions by motor vehicles.

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for stroke survivors
attributes.background: Make prescriptions free of charge on any medication for stroke survivors

attributes.action: Make it illegal for data companies to sell any personal data to any third party.
attributes.background: I receive in the region of 10-15 cold-calls every day. These calls cannot currently be blocked by BT and are only subject to Telephone Preference if made within the UK.
attributes.additional_details: If these calls were being made within the UK, and assuming that the person receiving them has signed up to TPS, then the company making the call could be prosecuted, as could the company who sold the data, because they had not made the required checks against the TPS data base. Unfortunately, this does not apply to overseas call centres. However, if the companies that sell this data were closed down, eventually the problem would stop.

attributes.action: Make all fuel stations / garage forecourts give free air and water.
attributes.background: It is a legal requirement to keep tyres inflated at the correct pressure and to have a clear visible view of the road. Stop making  people have to pay to keep there car legal on the road! Some garages already give free air and water. It's just more revenue for the fuel companies.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for NHS staff.
attributes.background: Many  companies provide discounts for their staff. Hardworking NHS staff also deserve a discounts.

attributes.action: Apply VAT on airfares to better fund the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is underfunded; at the end of 2015/16 the NHS had a deficit of £1.85 billion. Aviation is lightly taxed but harmful, eg it impairs children's learning ability and is detrimental to wildlife. It is also exacerbating our climate crisis and in 2014 produced over 11% of the UK’s total emissions.
attributes.additional_details:
Airline passengers do not pay fuel duty or VAT and APD can be as low as £13. We might think this makes annual holidays affordable but in fact undertaxed flights largely benefit affluent people who fly several times a year; 70% of flights are taken by only 15% of adults.

My petition is to apply VAT on airfares and for the additional revenue to be used to support our NHS. Most of us like an annual holiday but those of us who can afford 2 to 3 holidays each year can also afford to pay more tax.

attributes.action: Clearly state, at point of use, if NHS service is provided by the private sector
attributes.background:
The government is not being transparent regarding the number of NHS services being provided by the private sector. 

If a private company uses the NHS logo and provides an inadequate service, the reputation of the NHS is harmed.
attributes.additional_details:
I have worked in the NHS for 20 years. After the introduction of marketisation within the NHS, a huge amount of services have been contracted out. This trend is increasing. 
The cheapest provider is not always the best for improving services. Private companies withing to gain NHS contracts should have to provide EVIDENCE that they can deliver. They should be held to account when they fail. A halt on further NHS contracts to those companies would be a good idea.

attributes.action: Enforce the Consumer Rights Act to protect music, arts and sport fans from touts
attributes.background: Fans are being ripped-off by ticket resales. The Consumer Rights Act has not changed this. We demand that Parliament enact last year’s ticket resale amendment, which provides tougher sanctions for resale websites, and also require ticket resellers to reveal their identities.

attributes.action: Right tostrike in essential services replaced by referralto adjudication service
attributes.background: For too long commuters/patients/the public have been the victims of protracted disputes between the unions of essential service providers and local/central government employers. Strikes are a primitive/inefficient way of resolving disputes and should be replaced by a binding adjudication service

attributes.action: Hold a General Election to allow the British Public their say on Brexit
attributes.background: We've heard many politicians and much of the media insist that Brexit is a mandate for this or a mandate for that, but the only mandate the Government has is simply to 'Leave.' I propose we hold a General Election to unify the nation and give the public a chance to articulate what Brexit should mean
attributes.additional_details: We're on course to a Hard Brexit and straight into the arms of the USA and President Trump. This is not what we voted for. Many were swayed by the promise from prominent Leave campaigners that we'd receive an extra £350 million a week for the NHS. Even more powerful was the idea that we could 'Take Control' and 'Make Britain Great Again.' Without an election, the British Public are robbed of the control they were promised and denied the chance to play their bit to make Britain Great, again.

attributes.action: Petition to increase the lowest acceptable broadband speed from 2Mbps to 10Mbps
attributes.background: The Government definition of 'basic broadband' is 2Mbps. At 2Mbps many internet services do not work. Internet usage must be limited to 1 person per household and it is difficult to load the government's own HMRC site - making life difficult for SMEs and the self employed.
attributes.additional_details: From experience, I know it is easy for Openreach to achieve speeds of 2Mbps through the UK's existing infrastructure (predominantly still copper wiring from the 1950s/60s). If the lowest acceptable broadband speed is not increased to 10Mbps, Openreach will focus on improving broadband in built up, high profit areas - areas that largely already have good internet access. The 5G roll out plan typifies this. If the focus is not shifted, many areas will never receive a decent internet connection.

attributes.action: Allow students undertaking work experience the right to accept/be paid
attributes.background: As of right now students who need to undertake work experience in order to complete their course are unable to accept pay from their work experience. Students have to take a large amount of time off from their usual jobs to complete work experience and most will miss out on a large amount of pay.
attributes.additional_details: Missing work, means missing pay and for some missing pay is the difference between being able to pay rent or not, being able to afford bills or even being able to afford food.

attributes.action: Make the National Lottery a direct fund of the National Health Service
attributes.background: Lottery money paid by all Citizens to be the income of the National Health Service

attributes.action: PSHE in all schools includes topics about domestic violence, LGBTQ+ and consent.
attributes.background: As pupils, we feel it necessary to have issues on domestic violence, LGBTQ+ rights and consent included in the curriculum of all senior PSHE lessons. We believe that this is crucial as all young adults should be well educated about these topics and should be able to access support and true facts.
attributes.additional_details: The Government has already talked about this issue, yet they briefly touched on it and didn't look leave enough time to fully discuss and vote on this important issue.

attributes.action: Allow the President of the United States to visit the UK to create trade options
attributes.background: Banning Donald Trump from entering the UK would diminish the chances of creating a competitive trade deal with the EU. Put differences aside and try and boost the UK's negotiation position at this crucial time. Donald Trump will leave office one day.
attributes.additional_details: The EU will soon enter into negotiations with the U.K.  To make sure that a competitive deal is reached that can benefit both sides, there needs to be viable alternatives. The United States is the largest economy in the world. To limit trade ties would be a waste just because the President has ideological differences. One day Donald Trump will leave office and it would have been a waste to sideline the President, Donald Trump has already expressed interest in UK trade.

attributes.action: Core travel infrastructure should seek ACAS approval prior to strike action
attributes.background: 2016 has seen various industrial strike actions due various industrial disputes. The Government should appoint an independent body i.e. ACAS (Advisory, Conciliation & Arbitration Service) to mediate between core travel businesses and Unions to ensure that any strike action is avoided where possible.
attributes.additional_details:
2016 saw an increase in strike action a total of 269,000 days lost due to industrial action since October 2016. This is over a 50% increase to the figures of 2015 which is 169,000 days lost due to industrial action (figures from Office for National Statistics)
Core travel infrastructure industrial actions needs to assure that Unions voices are heard with assurance that their request to strike are reasonable & limited. Strike action causes increased travel time and costs to thousands of commuters

attributes.action: Implement a 20% tariff on all goods imported from the United States of America
attributes.background:
After a row over who would pay for a wall between the USA & Mexico, a bilateral summit between the two nations was cancelled by the Mexican president.
In response, President Trump now seeks to impose a 20% tariff on all Mexican goods.
In response the UK should impose a similar penalty on the USA.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is to ask the house to debate the imposition of a similarly punitive trade tariff as that which President Trump wishes to impose on Mexico. The whole world needs to stand up to bullies and the UK should lead by example.

The last time the world appeased a bully, 80 years ago, it didn't end well.

attributes.action: Amend the planning guidance to increase the minimum size for car parking spaces.
attributes.background: Car parking space width is simply not wide enough to allow people to get out and in their vehicle comfortably enough.

attributes.action: Give a higher bursary to areas that are more deprived.
attributes.background: For some students £60/£100 over 12 weeks to cover travelling cost and lunch, is simply not enough.
attributes.additional_details: New schools are funded for bursaries on the assumption that 36% of students will be eligible, this is the national average. A higher level of deprivation area such as Newham will have a higher percentage that will need support whereas a Sixth from/College/Universities in an affluent area will have hardly any that need support. So, therefore, educational facilities in deprived areas must spread a small amount amongst many students, while educational institutions in affluent areas have more money than they need, which is not fair they should fund based on local needs, not the national average and in special cases fund specific students a lot more.
